description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fao0k","text":"Lipid droplets (LDs) are dynamic, ubiquitously present lipid-storage  organelles, predominantly present in the adipocytes. Triglycerides,  neutral lipids, and cholesterol esters stored in LDs are the largest  sources of energy. The presence of excess LDs in adipocytes results in  obesity and obesity-linked pathologies such as dyslipidemia and diabetes  type.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
